annotation: <history><entry><input>ssh user@ubuntu-vm</input><output>Welcome to Ubuntu 22.04 LTS</output><annotation>Connecting to an Ubuntu 22.04 virtual machine via SSH.</annotation></entry><entry><input>lsb_release -a</input><output>Distributor ID: Ubuntu Description:    Ubuntu 22.04 LTS Release:        22.04 Codename:       jammy</output><annotation>Checking the version and codename of the Ubuntu distribution using `lsb_release`.</annotation></entry><entry><input>sudo apt update</input><output>Get:1 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy InRelease [270 kB] ... Fetched 270 kB in 1s (498 kB/s) Reading package lists... Done</output><annotation>Updating the package index using `apt update`.</annotation></entry><entry><input>sudo apt upgrade -y</input><output>Reading package lists... Done Building dependency tree       Reading state information... Done Calculating upgrade... Done The following packages will be upgraded: libc-bin libc6 libc6-dev 3 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded. Need to get 16.3 MB of archives. After this operation, 3072 B of additional disk space will be used. ...</output><annotation>Upgrading the installed packages using `apt upgrade`.</annotation></entry><entry><input>sudo apt install -y git</input><output>Reading package lists... Done Building dependency tree       Reading state information... Done The following additional packages will be installed: git-man libc6-dev libcurl4-openssl-dev liberror-perl ...</output><annotation>Installing `git` along with its dependencies using `apt`.</annotation></entry><entry><input>git --version</input><output>git version 2.34.1</output><annotation>Checking the installed version of `git` to verify its installation.</annotation></entry><entry><input>sudo apt install -y vim</input><output>Reading package lists... Done Building dependency tree       Reading state information... Done The following additional packages will be installed: vim-common xxd ...</output><annotation>Installing the `vim` package using `apt`.</annotation></entry><entry><input>vim --version</input><output>VIM - Vi IMproved 8.2</output><annotation>Verifying the installation of `vim` by checking its version.</annotation></entry><entry><input>git clone https://github.com/git/git.git</input><output>Cloning into 'git'... remote: Enumerating objects: 3902, done. remote: Counting objects: 100% (3902/3902), done. remote: Compressing objects: 100% (3206/3206), done. remote: Total 3902 (delta 215), reused 3902 (delta 215), pack-reused 0 Receiving objects: 100% (3902/3902), 9.02 MiB | 3.37 MiB/s, done. Resolving deltas: 100% (215/215), done.</output><annotation>Cloning the official `git` repository from GitHub using the `git clone` command.</annotation></entry><entry><input>cd git</input><output></output><annotation>Changing the working directory to the cloned `git` repository.</annotation></entry><entry><input>make prefix=/usr/local all</input><output>make: Nothing to be done for 'all'.</output><annotation>Attempting to build `git` but the repository was already built.</annotation></entry><entry><input>sudo make prefix=/usr/local install</input><output>install -m 755 git /usr/local/bin/git ...</output><annotation>Installing the built `git` binaries using the `make install` command.</annotation></entry><entry><input>git --version</input><output>git version 2.34.1</output><annotation>Verifying the installation of the newly built `git` version by checking its version.</annotation></entry><entry><input>sudo apt remove -y git</input><output>Reading package lists... Done Building dependency tree       Reading state information... Done The following packages will be REMOVED: git git-man ...</output><annotation>Removing the `git` package installed through the package manager using `apt remove`.</annotation></entry><entry><input>git --version</input><output>git: 'git' is not installed. To install it, use:     sudo apt install git</output><annotation>Verifying that `git` was successfully removed from the system.</annotation></entry><entry><input>exit</input><output></output><annotation>Exiting the SSH session after completing the tasks.</annotation></entry></history>
